title.narrative: POLICY MONITORING AND EVALUATION

description.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities., which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue and evidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and the reduction of their main inequalities.

participating-org.narrative: ASOCIACION SERVICIO JESUITA PARA MIGRANTES COSTA RICA
FUNDACION DE UNIVERSIDAD COSTA RICA PARA LA INVESTIGACION

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Improved and integrated social proteciton data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Policy and strategy development and coordination
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration

related-activity.ref: 1020/A0/06/003 SOCIAL INCLUSION, PUBLIC ADVOCACY AND COMMUNICATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, the public sector, civil society, private sector, academia, media and adolescents have strengthened their dialogue andevidence based advocacy capacities for reaching social agreements towards the fulfillment of Children and Adolescent Rights and thereduction of their main inequalities.

description.narrative: During 2021, UNICEF Costa Rica provided support to governmental and non-governmental partners for the development of tools, methodologies, and coordination and management mechanisms aimed at building institutional capacities for developing, monitoring, and evaluating policies, programs, data and interventions for children and adolescents. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022

title.narrative: Mid-term evaluation of the National Childhood and Adolescence Agenda (ANNA) implemented.(57825), Text

baseline.value: Programmed evaluation by the Monitoring & Evaluation system of the ANNA presented to the National Children and Adolescents Council (CNNA) in 2016.

target.value: 2021:The recommendations of the evaluation have been included in the updated ANNA and CNNA Action Plan.

title.narrative: National government measurement of child poverty using multidimensional measures (25-01-L3-01), Text

baseline.value: The country makes the two measurements of poverty in childhood, the multidimensional and by means of the monetary poverty line.

target.value: 2022:The Country has a proposal to mesuare mutidimensional poverty

actual.value: 2021:Every year, the country develops a methodology for measuring multidimensional poverty, from which the reference for children can be obtained.

title.narrative: Developed a training strategy on Results Based Management (RBM) for the childhood and adolescence institutional sector.(57824)

baseline.value: The institutions that make up the childhood and adolescence sector don't implement an RBM approach.

target.value: 2020:At least two institutions from the childhood and adolescence institutional sector have implemented an RBM/ToC approach.

actual.value: 2020:We have worked with IMAS, MEP and PANI in the development and implementation of the GBR methodology for the programs that we are developing together.

title.narrative: Developed a proposal for the design and critical path of a Quality Assurance Management Model targeted towards children and adolescent's public services.(57826), Text

baseline.value: There is no Quality Assurance Management Model for children and adolescent services.

target.value: 2022:All institutions from the Childhood and Adolescence sector have been accredited for the quality of their services.
